answer_text: B&M is committed to implementing innovative and cost-effective solutions to its customers’ requirements on time, on budget, and with safety foremost in mind. Black & McDonald is a reliable and flexible contractor operating with integrity and loyalty to employees, customers, suppliers, and the communities we serve.

B&M will provide a labour force whose selection is based on the required skills and level of expertise. This ensures that best practices and leading edge methodologies are implemented for every contract with which we work. Our staff members continuously train and update their skills, providing our clients with expertise and knowledge in all areas of operation, maintenance, health and safety.

B&M is committed to protecting their people, their property and the environment and will take all necessary steps to provide and maintain a safe and healthy work environment. With a track record of success spanning over ten decades, B&M has built a solid reputation based on our company’s mission of providing our customers with quality and service that is second to none.

The project involves the design, construction, operation and maintenance of a new Travel Time (TT) System by replacing the existing TT system on multiple highway corridors in MTO Central Region, Ontario.

Black & McDonald Limited will provide warranty on all labour, equipment and materials provided. Upon completion of installation, all equipment and materials delivered will be free of material defects and will perform to the requisite standard for a period of five (5) years. All materials provided and work executed under this contract are covered by the warranty. Black & McDonald Limited will repair or replace any equipment that fails throughout the warranty period at no additional expense to the MTO. The B&M will provide warranty services in accordance with the Service Level Agreement's response times for repair or replacement of equipment that has failed. The Stinson AIS devices will be provided with a 5 year all-inclusive warranty which will commence at the time of system acceptance. Advanced replacement spares will be provided to B&M maintenance staff to have on hand during any service calls. In the case that the contract is extended for an additional 2 years, the warranty will be extended accordingly as well.

The project involves the design, construction, operation and maintenance of a new Travel Time (TT) System by replacing the existing TT system on multiple highway corridors in MTO Central Region, Ontario. The travel time information will be displayed on MTO owned VMS to assist the public to find out the travel time along alternate routes and plan their route selections accordingly as well as reducing congestion in work zones and around incidents.

B&M is responsible to provide, host, and manage a TT System Graphical User Interface (GUI) for MTO users to access. B&M will be responsible for developing a Test Plan including Pre-Installation Testing (PIT), Proof of Performance (POP), System Integration Testing (SIT), Pilot Demonstration Testing (PDT) and System Acceptance Testing (SAT).

B&M utilizes a well-defined and monitored job cost control system using Oracle’s JD Edwards (JDE) which acts as an early warning system to enable the Project Manager to review live project financials at any given moment, unlike some elaborate systems which provide little more than historical data long after opportunities for value engineering have passed.

B&M uses JDE to track and manage the change management process for all projects. Change Requests contain important information regarding a potential customer Change Order including; brief description, reference numbers, associated dates and all required adjustments to estimated man-hours, cost and revenue which impact the overall budget of a job.

B&M understands that effective stakeholder management is a key skill for our Project Managers who are accountable for end-to-end project management and execution. B&M creates a stakeholder plan that identifies the stakeholders, discusses goals, determines work methods and identifies project/work scope risks.

B&M prioritises on-time and on-budget project completion and uses Microsoft Project to achieve this goal. It enables all of the associated requirements, milestones, and ultimate completion dates involved in the completion of the project delivered through an integrated team method to be mutually established and easily updated. Every project is assigned to a dedicated Project Scheduler who is primarily responsible for assisting the Project Manager in scheduling activities such as creating baseline schedules, updating schedules weekly or biweekly to integrate change orders, defining and monitoring the Critical Path of the project, and rising any anticipated delays issues to the Project Manager.

B&M has a Quality Assurance / Quality Control Policy and Program in place that will comply with our client's Quality Management needs' principles and objectives. Our Program was established to fulfill, and then surpass, our client's quality assurance standards through continual evaluation and improvement. The goal of B&M's Program is to increase efficiency and lower project costs while maintaining the highest level of quality in every performed work. Through training sessions, seminars, access to educational resources, and IMSA certification courses, B&M promotes quality work by developing and maintaining our workforce knowledge.

The Stinson AIS sensor is designed and manufactured by Stinson ITS Inc. in its Woodbridge, ON facility. Each device goes through a series of Factory Acceptance Tests (FAT) which includes manual testing and verification of each subsystem component is functioning properly. These include verifying core device functions such as Bluetooth detection, WiFi detection, onboard Web Server operation, NTP sync, Factory reset and firmware update are operating correctly. After initial testing each device also goes through a 7 day burn in period. Devices are tested again upon completion of the burn in.
Comprehensive System Testing will also mitigate risks of software errors and issues. The project will undergo comprehensive testing, in adherence with standard MTO processes.

B&M has in place a Public Protection & Traffic Management Planning tenet to make sure B&M authorized employees comprehend the necessities for and to provide protection for workers and the public by regulating traffic flow and implementing efficient traffic control plans.

B&M believes that the measures we take will help drive B&M closer to our vision of a workplace where 'Nobody Gets Hurt Today or Tomorrow'. Our management team is committed to putting our people first in meeting our customer's challenges in the most critical environments.

The Travel Time system will gather data from Bluetooth and Wifi detectors. The data will be transmitted to ITS Central control software, and be used to estimate travel times along roadways within the scope area, between detectors, and between specified origin destination pairs.

The Stinson AIS participated in an MTO project in 2016 to test a variety of alternative Bluetooth detection devices to determine their accuracy and penetration rates. The results of the testing confirmed that the Stinson AIS met industry standards for both metrics and as such were well suited for travel time applications on roadways.

Stinson will be supplying solar systems for all of the standalone sites that are called for in this project. The system will provide 12 days of autonomy and will utilize a solar panel twice as large as is needed such that it can fully charge even in cloudy conditions or when the panel is partially covered in snow.

For hosting, we propose the services of OVH (https://www.ovh.com/). It is one of the largest internet hosting companies in the world, with 400,000 servers, 33 data centers in 4 continents and 1.6 million customers. It is fully certified: PCI DSS, ISO/IEC 27001, 27017, 27018, 27701, 50001, SOC 1, SOC 2 and SOC 3, Cloud Security Alliance STAR certified.

As part of the contract, Transnomis Solutions will procure three dedicated servers with OVH data center in Beauharnois, QC. One server will be the primary server hosting the ITS Central application. The second (fail-over) server will be used for live streaming replication, which will be ready to take over immediately should the primary server fails. The third server will also have live streaming replication serving as hot spare.

A total of 3 servers, hosted professionally by OVH within Canada, will be utilized in this project to achieve full system triple redundancy and fail-over. OVH has technician and security on-site 24/7. It has systematic double power supply, 250 kVA UPS and generators with an initial autonomy of 48 hours. It has a minimum of 2 network connections and two network rooms within each of its data centers. In addition to the primary server, an identical software installation will be created in two additional servers – one for failover and one for hot spare. The database will be set up with streaming replication such that the databases in all three (3) servers will always be in sync. In the event the primary server fails, the secondary server can quickly and automatically take over to become the primary server. Transnomis will then reconfigure streaming replication such that the secondary server will stream to the tertiary server, and reconfigure the failover to be the tertiary server. The failed server will then be replaced.

Although hosting is provided by reliable third party, Transnomis Solutions is fully responsible for the availability of its software service. The Ministry will never have to deal with the hosting company. Transnomis Solutions will be the single point of contact for all issues related to services provided for this contract, including server availability issues.
Data shall be hosted and stored by the Proponent within Canada utilizing cloud-based solution, outside of MTO premises.
The Proponent shall store a minimum of six (6) months of historical raw data for auditing purposes, including individual timestamped encrypted MAC ID records with their associated Bluetooth Readers.
MTO shall own all data, including aggregated and archived data.

The Proponent shall perform a regular data dump to MTO. MTO to provide the Proponent with details on frequency of these data dumps and which data to include. Data to include at minimum processed travel time data for all links and routes in Central Region.
The GUI shall provide a dashboard for MTO to access real-time travel time and hardware (Bluetooth reader, VMS) information.
The dashboard shall provide information on travel time index (TTI) for links and routes. TTI = TT (real-time) / TT (free-flow).
The reporting system shall be able to report on any user-specified historical time period and location.
The reports from the reporting system shall be generated in a printer-friendly and clearly organized format.
The Proponent shall be responsible for all maintenance of the Solution during the Term of Agreement.

In the event the Proponent makes any changes to its processes or methodologies during the Term of Agreement, including but not limited to data collection, processing methodology, storage, hosting, or cybersecurity, the Proponent shall inform MTO in detail of these changes in advance.

Transnomis' ITS Central software is currently installed as the Advanced Traffic Management System in the City of Edmonton, Region of York, Region of Durham, MTO East Region, and BC Ferries. In addition, ITS Central is the control software being used for MTO's Queue and Stopped Vehicle Advisory System (QSVAS) on Highway 405, which is currently in the Operational Performance Test (OPT) period. ITS Central specializes in retrieving data and device status information from the field devices it’s integrated with, including the Stinson AIS Bluetooth/WiFi sensor, cellular modems, CCTV cameras, variable message signs, vehicle detectors, traffic signals, and various weather detection equipment (e.g., atmospheric sensors, wind meters, pavement sensors, etc.).

Stinson will be supplying solar systems for all of the standalone sites that are called for in this project. Stinson has been designing and manufacturing solar systems for over 7 years and has extensive experience.

Black & McDonald (B&M) will be responsible for System Operational Support, Warranty, System Emergency Repairs, and System Routine Maintenance for the TT system. B&M will maintain fault free operation of the TT system including the hardware and software parts as well as maintaining effective working conditions according to the contract's specifications. B&M project management team will review the restrictions outline in Appendix C3 and create a maintenance plan based on information provided. The maintenance team will carry out successful coordination with any other contractors to stay away from working in the same area by providing the advanced notice to the contract administrator or representative from general contractors. In line with the Agreement, the MTO will decide on a course of action with respect to such material or equipment. When Black & McDonald Limited is notified of an occurrence, it must respond within the specified time frame. Any incidents will be documented in detail and reported to the MTO, with a summary of the root cause and corrective action taken.
B&M will ensure that technical support response times will comply with response and resolution limit requirements and associated penalties for outages as outlined in the SLA section 3.2.

The project team will prepare a template for monthly field maintenance service. The template will be completed on a monthly basis, based on maintenance services provided and submitted to the MTO.

The management of materials and equipment is crucial to maintaining quick response and repair times. All spare parts, materials, and consumables will be inventoried and placed into a digital inventory management system.

The Watch Dog process will ensure that between the primary and secondary servers, ITS Central will be highly available with no more than 10 minutes downtime should there be any system failures with the primary server. Database replication is a built-in feature of PostgreSQL. In particular, PostgreSQL supports Logical Replication. Logical replication allows fine-grained control over both data replication and security. Logical replication uses a publish and subscribe model with one or more subscribers subscribing to one or more publications on a publisher node.

The Travel Time system will gather data from Bluetooth and Wifi detectors. The data will be transmitted to ITS Central control software, and be used to estimate travel times along roadways within the scope area, between detectors, and between specified origin destination pairs.

When designing the Stinson AIS, ease of installation and configuration were two key factors we focused on throughout the process. For hosting, we propose the services of OVH (https://www.ovh.com/). It is one of the largest internet hosting companies in the world, with 400,000 servers, 33 data centers in 4 continents and 1.6 million customers. It is fully certified: PCI DSS, ISO/IEC 27001, 27017, 27018, 27701, 50001, SOC 1, SOC 2 and SOC 3, Cloud Security Alliance STAR certified. OVH.com has a data center in Beauharnois, QC. Its facility is highly secure with access only by authorized employees. It has technician and security on-site 24/7. It has systematic double power supply, 250 kVA UPS and generators with an initial autonomy of 48 hours. It has a minimum of 2 network connections and two network rooms within each of its data centers.

As part of the contract, Transnomis Solutions will procure three dedicated servers with OVH data center in Beauharnois, QC. One server will be the primary server hosting the ITS Central application. The second (fail-over) server will be used for live streaming replication, which will be ready to take over immediately should the primary server fails. The third server will also have live streaming replication serving as hot spare. Although hosting is provided by reliable third party, Transnomis Solutions is fully responsible for the availability of its software service. The Ministry will never have to deal with the hosting company. Transnomis Solutions will be the single point of contact for all issues related to services provided for this contract, including server availability issues.
The Proponent shall store a minimum of six (6) months of historical raw data for auditing purposes, including individual timestamped encrypted MAC ID records with their associated Bluetooth Readers.
MTO shall own all data, including aggregated and archived data.
The Proponent shall be responsible for all maintenance of the Solution during the Term of Agreement.

In the event the Proponent makes any changes to its processes or methodologies during the Term of Agreement, including but not limited to data collection, processing methodology, storage, hosting, or cybersecurity, the Proponent shall inform MTO in detail of these changes in advance.
The Solution shall automatically send the configuration file detailing the current system configuration to MTO on the last business day of every month.

keywords: Queue and Stopped Vehicle Advisory System
answer_text: Transnomis’ ITS Central software is currently installed as the Advanced Traffic Management System in the City of Edmonton, Region of York, Region of Durham, MTO East Region, and BC Ferries. In addition, ITS Central is the control software being used for MTO’s Queue and Stopped Vehicle Advisory System (QSVAS) on Highway 405, which is currently in the Operational Performance Test (OPT) period. ITS Central specializes in retrieving data and device status information from the field devices it’s integrated with, including the Stinson AIS Bluetooth/WiFi sensor, cellular modems, CCTV cameras, variable message signs, vehicle detectors, traffic signals, and various weather detection equipment (e.g., atmospheric sensors, wind meters, pavement sensors, etc.).
ITS Central publishes processed data to an XML file using HTTPS secured data feeds. See Requirement 5.3.1 for examples of the XML feed output.

A total of 3 servers, hosted professionally by OVH within Canada, will be utilized in this project to achieve full system triple redundancy and fail-over. OVH has technician and security on-site 24/7. It has systematic double power supply, 250 kVA UPS and generators with an initial autonomy of 48 hours. It has a minimum of 2 network connections and two network rooms within each of its data centers.

ITS Central employs advanced algorithmic calculation of travel times between sensors by aggregating and filtering the raw travel time data eliminating aberrations and outliers. The parameters for this algorithm are configurable.

Transnomis has previously provided numerous custom REST API data feeds as per client requirements, such as the VDS and VMS API provided for the MTO QSVAS project. ITS Central does not distinguish between routes or links, in that both routes and links are calculated using the same travel time algorithm.

Transnomis Solutions will be the single point of contact for all issues related to services provided for this contract, including server availability issues.

Historical aggregated travel time information shall be stored and accessible to users for the duration of the Contract. Historical aggregated travel time information is stored in ITS Central's database, and will be accessible for the duration of the contract.

The GUI shall provide a dashboard for MTO to access real-time travel time and hardware (Bluetooth reader, VMS) information. ITS Central includes a robust configurable dashboard that can display real-time travel time, and hardware/maintenance issues.

The Proponent shall be responsible for obtaining and renewing the map license. Transnomis will be responsible for obtaining and renewing the map license throughout the duration of the contracted agreement period.
Transnomis will setup access to the data feeds for partners who require access, as requested and authorized by MTO.
Transnomis has previously developed various custom data feeds for customers, including a couple of data feeds for the MTO’s QSVAS project.
Transnomis will keep the ITS Central software up to date with the latest available software updates for the duration of the Term of Agreement.
The project team will be responsible for all maintenance of the solution during the term of the agreement. Details are provided in the Operations and Maintenance plan of in the proposal.
Black & McDonald will be responsible for System Operational Support, Warranty, System Emergency Repairs, and System Routine Maintenance for the TT system.

During the operational and maintenance phases of the contract, Black & McDonald will be responsible for monitoring the operation of all ITS components including BT readers installed under the contract.
Field devices will be monitored by ITS Central, and notifications will be sent to B&M if a device failure is detected.
Transnomis will work with MTO to setup the automatic transfer of the configuration file to MTO on the last business day of every month.

To establish a proper project management practices and to ensure they are implemented and maintained for the 5 years-term duration of this contract and as per the SLA execution plan. A comprehensive project safety and environmental management plan will be developed and submitted to the MTO for review. The project's safety and environmental protection plan will go through site-specific safety hazards, risk mitigation measures, and environmental protection strategy, as well as a list of all hospitals and clinics in the area. All environmental work will be conducted in compliance with MTO Environmental Reference of Highway Design regulations (ERD). This plan will be reviewed by the project's management team before submitting it to the MTO for approval.

Routine maintenance services will be scheduled in accordance to the approved Scheduled System Maintenance Plan. It will be conducted for all TT system components within the contract limits. Routine maintenance and inspection services will comply with the Equipment Specific Scheduled Maintenance Requirements outline in the SLA, manufacture recommendations and be in accordance with the ITS elements and operation and maintenance manuals.

To create a document control system to guarantee that all routine maintenance reports are completed, structured, and available to the MTO. To put in place an electronic ticketing system to track, manage, and respond to system outages and other operational concerns. To monitor and record monthly system performance, ensuring system performance metric and submitted to the MTO each month along with the monthly invoice.

Black & McDonald Limited will provide warranty on all labour, equipment and materials provided. Upon completion of installation, all equipment and materials delivered will be free of material defects and will perform to the requisite standard for a period of five (5) years. All materials provided and work executed under this contract are covered by the warranty. Black & McDonald Limited will repair or replace any equipment that fails throughout the warranty period at no additional expense to the MTO. The B&M will provide warranty services in accordance with the Service Level Agreement's response times for repair or replacement of equipment that has failed. The Stinson AIS devices will be provided with a 5 year all-inclusive warranty which will commence at the time of system acceptance. Advanced replacement spares will be provided to B&M maintenance staff to have on hand during any service calls. In the case that the contract is extended for an additional 2 years, the warranty will be extended accordingly as well.

A total of 3 servers, hosted professionally by OVH within Canada, will be utilized in this project to achieve full system triple redundancy and fail-over. OVH has technician and security on-site 24/7. It has systematic double power supply, 250 kVA UPS and generators with an initial autonomy of 48 hours. It has a minimum of 2 network connections and two network rooms within each of its data centers. In addition to the primary server, an identical software installation will be created in two additional servers – one for failover and one for hot spare. The database will be set up with streaming replication such that the databases in all three (3) servers will always be in sync. In the event the primary server fails, the secondary server can quickly and automatically take over to become the primary server.

B&M has in place a Public Protection & Traffic Management Planning tenet to make sure B&M authorized employees comprehend the necessities for and to provide protection for workers and the public by regulating traffic flow and implementing efficient traffic control plans.

For hosting, we propose the services of OVH (https://www.ovh.com/). It is one of the largest internet hosting companies in the world, with 400,000 servers, 33 data centers in 4 continents and 1.6 million customers. It is fully certified: PCI DSS, ISO/IEC 27001, 27017, 27018, 27701, 50001, SOC 1, SOC 2 and SOC 3, Cloud Security Alliance STAR certified. OVH.com has a data center in Beauharnois, QC. Its facility is highly secure with access only by authorized employees. It has technician and security on-site 24/7. It has systematic double power supply, 250 kVA UPS and generators with an initial autonomy of 48 hours. It has a minimum of 2 network connections and two network rooms within each of its data centers.

As part of the contract, Transnomis Solutions will procure three dedicated servers with OVH data center in Beauharnois, QC. One server will be the primary server hosting the ITS Central application. The second (fail-over) server will be used for live streaming replication, which will be ready to take over immediately should the primary server fails. The third server will also have live streaming replication serving as hot spare. Although hosting is provided by reliable third party, Transnomis Solutions is fully responsible for the availability of its software service. The Ministry will never have to deal with the hosting company. Transnomis Solutions will be the single point of contact for all issues related to services provided for this contract, including server availability issues.

Transnomis’ ITS Central software is currently installed as the Advanced Traffic Management System in the City of Edmonton, Region of York, Region of Durham, MTO East Region, and BC Ferries. In addition, ITS Central is the control software being used for MTO’s Queue and Stopped Vehicle Advisory System (QSVAS) on Highway 405, which is currently in the Operational Performance Test (OPT) period. ITS Central specializes in retrieving data and device status information from the field devices it’s integrated with, including the Stinson AIS Bluetooth/WiFi sensor, cellular modems, CCTV cameras, variable message signs, vehicle detectors, traffic signals, and various weather detection equipment (e.g., atmospheric sensors, wind meters, pavement sensors, etc.).
ITS Central publishes processed data to an XML file using HTTPS secured data feeds. See Requirement 5.3.1 for examples of the XML feed output.

ITS Central is designed to be fully scalable, to include future geographic expansion and inclusion of additional routes. In addition, adding additional Bluetooth readers and VMS’s is a common request by our previous clients, and can be easily accommodated.

Our ITS Central software is designed to operate continuously, 24/7/365. Our ITS Central Advanced Traffic Management Systems in the City of Edmonton, Region of York, Region of Durham, MTO East Region, and BC Ferries operate continuously (24/7/365). MTO’s QSVAS is also designed for continuous operations. Our systems in Toronto, Oklahoma, and California are also running 24/7/365. High availability features, and redundancy are designed within our proposed system, including triple servers, failover, device monitoring.

A total of 3 servers, hosted professionally by OVH within Canada, will be utilized in this project to achieve full system triple redundancy and fail-over. OVH has technician and security on-site 24/7. It has systematic double power supply, 250 kVA UPS and generators with an initial autonomy of 48 hours. It has a minimum of 2 network connections and two network rooms within each of its data centers.
The unmatched encrypted MAC ID's, processing statuses, conditions, recalculations, and anomalies are recorded by ITS Central, as well as the processed data.
Transnomis has already customized three XML data feeds in accordance to the MTO data specifications provided.

Data shall be hosted and stored by the Proponent within Canada utilizing cloud-based solution, outside of MTO premises. For hosting, we propose the services of OVH (https://www.ovh.com/). It is one of the largest internet hosting companies in the world, with 400,000 servers, 33 data centers in 4 continents and 1.6 million customers. It is fully certified: PCI DSS, ISO/IEC 27001, 27017, 27018, 27701, 50001, SOC 1, SOC 2 and SOC 3, Cloud Security Alliance STAR certified.

ITS Central stores aggregated travel time information that includes: Link, route, travel time, VMS ID, number of encrypted MAC ID matches, VMS messages from the generated sign-based TT message XML feed.
ITS Central includes robust reporting tools. Transnomis will customize reports within ITS Central to address all of MTO’s needs.
The dashboard is user configurable, and can be configured easily to include a map view that suits the individual operator’s needs.
ITS Central allows for historical data to be readily accessible to MTO users as soon as the travel time information is computed and published, in real-time.

The project involves the design, construction, operation and maintenance of a new Travel Time (TT) System by replacing the existing TT system on multiple highway corridors in MTO Central Region, Ontario. The travel time information will be displayed on MTO owned VMS to assist the public to find out the travel time along alternate routes and plan their route selections accordingly as well as reducing congestion in work zones and around incidents.

B&M is responsible to provide, host, and manage a TT System Graphical User Interface (GUI) for MTO users to access. B&M will be responsible for developing a Test Plan including Pre-Installation Testing (PIT), Proof of Performance (POP), System Integration Testing (SIT), Pilot Demonstration Testing (PDT) and System Acceptance Testing (SAT).

B&M utilizes a well-defined and monitored job cost control system using Oracle’s JD Edwards (JDE) which acts as an early warning system to enable the Project Manager to review live project financials at any given moment, unlike some elaborate systems which provide little more than historical data long after opportunities for value engineering have passed.

B&M uses JDE to track and manage the change management process for all projects. Change Requests contain important information regarding a potential customer Change Order including; brief description, reference numbers, associated dates and all required adjustments to estimated man-hours, cost and revenue which impact the overall budget of a job.

B&M understands that effective stakeholder management is a key skill for our Project Managers who are accountable for end-to-end project management and execution. B&M creates a stakeholder plan that identifies the stakeholders, discusses goals, determines work methods and identifies project/work scope risks.

B&M prioritises on-time and on-budget project completion and uses Microsoft Project to achieve this goal. It enables all of the associated requirements, milestones, and ultimate completion dates involved in the completion of the project delivered through an integrated team method to be mutually established and easily updated.

B&M has a Quality Assurance / Quality Control Policy and Program in place that will comply with our client's Quality Management needs' principles and objectives. Our Program was established to fulfill, and then surpass, our client's quality assurance standards through continual evaluation and improvement.

The Stinson AIS sensor is designed and manufactured by Stinson ITS Inc. in its Woodbridge, ON facility. Each device goes through a series of Factory Acceptance Tests (FAT) which includes manual testing and verification of each subsystem component is functioning properly.
Software system quality control will follow quality control methodologies to ensure that the software is error free, and that operational errors are detected and rectified quickly.

The Travel Time system will gather data from Bluetooth and Wifi detectors. The data will be transmitted to ITS Central control software, and be used to estimate travel times along roadways within the scope area, between detectors, and between specified origin destination pairs. Additional travel time data will be received from interjurisdictional partners, and processed by ITS Central.

The Stinson AIS participated in an MTO project in 2016 to test a variety of alternative Bluetooth detection devices to determine their accuracy and penetration rates. This testing was performed on Hwy 26 near Wasaga Beach and involved three vendor devices: Iteris Vantage, ISS Deep Blue, and the Stinson AIS. WSP performed the testing and evaluation which focused on the Accuracy and Penetration rate of each sensor to determine if they met industry standards.

ITS Central provides a chart for the distribution of travel times for a specified time period and location. The reporting system shall have the ability to generate reports based on ad-hoc queries, including but not limited to: Selection of any Bluetooth reader to generate reports of detected Bluetooth-enabled device counts (reads) at any date; and Selection of any two routes to generate and display differences in the number of matches and travel time for a selected time interval. ITS Central provides users to select any Bluetooth reader to generate reports of the detection counts for any time period. In addition, user can also select any two travel time paths (routes) and display the differences in the number of matches and travel times for any selected time interval.

The reports from the reporting system shall be generated in a printer-friendly and clearly organized format. Reports are preconfigured to be printer friendly and organized. It is anticipated that some further customization and feedback from MTO will be needed to ensure reports meet MTO’s needs.

To establish a proper project management practices and to ensure they are implemented and maintained for the 5 years-term duration of this contract and as per the SLA execution plan. This plan will indicate all staff, staff responsibilities, resources, schedules and operating guidelines. The plan shall include a description of the processes and tasks required to carry out the Operations, Maintenance and Support of the TT Service including the procedures that address requirements of subsections 1.4.1, 1.4.2 and 1.4.3 of the SLA document.

Routine maintenance services will be scheduled in accordance to the approved Scheduled System Maintenance Plan. It will be conducted for all TT system components within the contract limits. Routine maintenance and inspection services will comply with the Equipment Specific Scheduled Maintenance Requirements outline in the SLA, manufacture recommendations and be in accordance with the ITS elements and operation and maintenance manuals.

To create a document control system to guarantee that all routine maintenance reports are completed, structured, and available to the MTO. To put in place an electronic ticketing system to track, manage, and respond to system outages and other operational concerns.

Creating a detailed emergency maintenance plan to prepare the project team for emergency maintenance / repair calls. Emergency response plan for ITS equipment will be based on manufacturer recommendations and installation / operation guides.

For the length of the contract, a 24-hour emergency dispatch center will be constructed and staffed. The MTO will be provided with dispatch contact information. The project schedule will be assigned primary and backup on-call workforce.

Black & McDonald Limited will provide warranty on all labour, equipment and materials provided. Upon completion of installation, all equipment and materials delivered will be free of material defects and will perform to the requisite standard for a period of five (5) years. All materials provided and work executed under this contract are covered by the warranty. Black & McDonald Limited will repair or replace any equipment that fails throughout the warranty period at no additional expense to the MTO. The B&M will provide warranty services in accordance with the Service Level Agreement's response times for repair or replacement of equipment that has failed. The Stinson AIS devices will be provided with a 5 year all-inclusive warranty which will commence at the time of system acceptance. Advanced replacement spares will be provided to B&M maintenance staff to have on hand during any service calls. In the case that the contract is extended for an additional 2 years, the warranty will be extended accordingly as well.

A total of 3 servers, hosted professionally by OVH within Canada, will be utilized in this project to achieve full system triple redundancy and fail-over. OVH has technician and security on-site 24/7. It has systematic double power supply, 250 kVA UPS and generators with an initial autonomy of 48 hours. It has a minimum of 2 network connections and two network rooms within each of its data centers. In addition to the primary server, an identical software installation will be created in two additional servers – one for failover and one for hot spare. The database will be set up with streaming replication such that the databases in all three (3) servers will always be in sync. In the event the primary server fails, the secondary server can quickly and automatically take over to become the primary server.
